text: so I'm Bob Sutton um a professor of
management science and engineering at
Stanford that's part of the engineering
school I've been here almost 30
years some of the kind of stuff that
I've done is taught diverse classes and
everything from um Innovation which is
what uh my class is about to uh
leadership to spreading Excellence from
those who have it to those who don't
I've taught a lot of General management
classes in terms of my research I tend
to do research on three different areas
the first one is in general how you
manage how you lead so I've done stuff
on turning knowledge into action I've
done um books on bosses good boss bad
boss and I wrote a PL a book on
workplace jerks um that has sort of a
dirty title so that's sort of the
management stuff the second thing that I
work on in my teaching and my research
is on um Innovation and creativity
something I've taught a lot something
I've written about I wrote a book called
weird ideas that work and quite a few
articles I've done a lot of ethnographic
sort of anthropological research on um
Innovation and the final thing is my
latest sort of passion and excitement
with my colleague Huggy ra Haag grieva
ra at the Stanford Business School is
we're interested in this challenge that
we call scaling up Excellence which is
when you've got a great little company
how you make it into a great big company
or in a larger
organization if you've got little
pockets of Excellence say pockets of
excellent health care or um places where
people are especially Innovative how you
spread that around the system so I'm
spending a lot of my time these days
focused on the challenge of spreading
Excellence from the few to the
many I I think I'm enthusiastic about
what I'm doing it we first of all
because I think the workplace does
matter and uh second of all I'm an
emotional person and I get to sort of
study the emotional part of of life and
then and then the other reason I'm
excited about what I'm doing is to be
perfectly honest that I'm um fortunate
to be in a workplace where hardly
anybody ever tells me what to do so that
makes me really
happy oh I guess I'm an innovator
although what is it most of my best
friends are entrepreneurs I it's the
reason that that I'm an I'm an innovator
rather than an entrepreneur is I think
of entrepreneurs as people who want to
start with a small kernel or something
and build it into something big I kind
of just want to do be left alone to do
stuff I think is cool so I think I'm
more of an innovator even though I kind
of like hanging out with
entrepreneurs fortunate to be surrounded
with incredibly hardworking incredibly
smart people um especially the students
who are absolutely fantastic they are so
smart they work so hard um it just
amazes and humbles me every day and when
Silicon Valley and Stanford work best
there's this notion that although we
come from all different places we're all
sort of weaving ourselves together in
such a way where everybody is feels
great about the work they're doing they
feel pride and also um they sort of feel
like uh they're developing relationships
that will feel good for a long time
[Music]
